oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Captain Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Capt. Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA writes this letter as his regiment moves from Lebanon, Tennessee to Virginia. The 7th Tenn. served in the Army of Northern Virginia during the war. Norris comments on Chattanooga, "Chattanooga is; a small place not so large as Lebanon and known only by the number of railroads passing though it". He writes about battles in the mountains of Virginia and in Missouri and makes mention of the Unionist sentiments in East Tennessee.
